title: trundles q tooltip.
body:
this is the actual ingame tooltip.

>Chomp

>Trundle lunges at his opponent with his next basic attack, dealing 20/40/60/80/100 (+0.8/0.9/1/1.1/1.2) physical damage** and briefly slowing his target. **
>This attack increases Trundle's Attack Damage by 20/25/30/35/40 for 8 seconds, with his opponent losing half of this amount. 

are you for real riot? what does "briefly slowing his target" mean? by how much? for how long?

personally, im already anoyed how i have to either google for champion kits or open a custom game whenever i want actual relevant information about a champions ability, because the in client pages are entirely useless due to their vague description instead of providing actual numbers. even the pages here on your homepage are often missing valuable info like ability cooldowns.

but i dont even know how to describe this. isnt that a little bit embarassing? please update your champion pages here to contain all the information about champions abilities. and please update this ingame tooltip and any others that are missing crucial information.

Trundle, prerework, had one immense weakness: His animations all took freaking years to perform.

Whilst Trundle's new Q is quick by old standards (Old Q animation literally took 2 seconds, during which he couldn't move or auto or anything) it's still a pretty long animation by current guidelines. This is especially problematic given Trundle is an AA reliant zone-control champion who doesn't have any gap closers other than a stationary movement speed increase and a stationary snare zone.

To counteract this, Trundle's Q applies a fairly hefty snare (I think it was nerfed down to 60%?) for the duration of the animation. I think it's .25 seconds?

His chomp slows for like .1 seconds by 75% to make it look like he's actually biting the target.  It's really not a significant part of the power and is there more for cosmetic reasons than to give him another slow.
